1.title: The Fog and the Milk Run
1.excerpt: On the first morning of 2026, Priya steps into the fog for something as small—and important—as milk.

2.title: The Photocopy File
2.excerpt: A deadline turns the morning into a small, familiar pilgrimage: tea, a queue, and the warm weight of papers in a plastic folder.

3.title: The Stamp and the Token
3.excerpt: A first-Saturday bank queue turns one small fee into a whole morning—until a purple stamp makes it real.

4.title: Raised Dots
4.excerpt: On a slow Sunday, Priya waits for one small confirmation and finds a different way of reading proof.

5.title: Home Row
5.excerpt: Two small bumps on a keyboard nudge Priya from waiting into practising.

6.title: Fifteen Minutes
6.excerpt: Priya’s first typing lesson is short enough to survive, and serious enough to matter.

7.title: Key Pressure
7.excerpt: On the second day of typing practice, Priya learns that ‘soft’ can still mean serious.

8.title: Name on the Screen
8.excerpt: On the third day, Priya tries to make her fingers believe what her mind already wants.

9.title: Borrowed Warmth
9.excerpt: A cold-wave holiday makes the lane quieter—and gives Priya a chance to test her ‘educated fingers’ on something real.
